p: Further work has investigated the inoculation of human subjects divided into non-smokers, smokers and COPD groups with RV-16 (Proud et al. 1950). Interestingly, a larger proportion of smokers (78.6 %) were successfully inoculated with the virus, compared to those with COPD (66.7 %) or non-smokers (58 %). RV16 was shown to increase α-defensin secretion in the sputum 9 days post-infection compared to baseline, but this was only observed in the COPD group (Mallia et al. 2012). RV-16 infection also resulted in increased neutrophil elastase, which may subsequently degrade secreted host defence peptides.
